TopicTitle: Do you have a screenshot that makes you laugh every time?

Articles.Content:
A completely normal day for Jeb...

![IVIBNuM.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/IVIBNuM.jpg)

I once tried to build a space kraken from the hangar

It bloody blew up the mission control building from the hangar.

![X2D6HF8.png](http://i.imgur.com/X2D6HF8.png)

> 
> 
> 15 minutes ago, cbplayer2012 said:
> 
> 
> I once tried to build a space kraken from the hangar
> 
> 
> 
> 
> It bloody blew up the mission control building from the hangar.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [![X2D6HF8.png](http://i.imgur.com/X2D6HF8.png)](http://i.imgur.com/X2D6HF8.png "Enlarge image")
> 

Is it me, or does anyone feel incognito at times? Welp, Never Mind since I'm gonna contribute anyway. Its my first Mun Landing so don't harsh...but hey atleast the capsule survived ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif ":0.0:")

(Image is Broke, go vist my Munar Rescue Page for the Screenie xD)

"Yay, we're not dead!" \o/

![uUCYuZf.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/uUCYuZf.jpg)

This cargo bay setup makes me chuckle a little bit every time I see it... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-10T11:28:08Z" title="06/10/2016 11:28  AM" data-short="8 yr">June 10, 2016</time> by el\_coyoto**

"Jeb, I think you may be glad you weren't in that part of the rocket when it.. went wacko..."

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/53X3f/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Though it doesn't make me laugh, I still snicker at it every now and then.

![iaLZZLG.png](http://i.imgur.com/iaLZZLG.png)
![VC1tI47.png](http://i.imgur.com/VC1tI47.png)

This was taken during a test launch of an Eve ascent-vehicle I was designing.  
  
![AFAC37B77CEB4311D3257D3859032291F904A080](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/695033174508647009/AFAC37B77CEB4311D3257D3859032291F904A080/)  

By the looks of it, Sidgas Kerman was not completely sold on the design.

It doesn't make me laugh (almost nothing does), but it's the best face I've seen a kerbal make.

![3LvnJ2W.png](http://i.imgur.com/3LvnJ2W.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-13T18:21:04Z" title="06/13/2016 06:21  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 13, 2016</time> by CelticCossack51**
  
I doesn't make me laugh... Yea, no
![d5v66Bx.png](http://i.imgur.com/d5v66Bx.png)

This was the funniest vid evar =D

After serious budget cuts at the Kerbal Space Agency, they turn to the one contractor they can still afford: Bargain Rocket Parts Inc.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/V4XdBFY17ks?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

I wish I had the foresight to vid capture it, but in the VAB I once saw a kerbal look at his clipboard, look at the rocket, look back at his clipboard, and run away screaming.  Probably just an effect of camera angle but it was perfect and hilarious.

> 
> 
> On 6/12/2016 at 8:05 PM, cbplayer2012 said:
> 
> 
> [![d5v66Bx.png](http://i.imgur.com/d5v66Bx.png)](http://i.imgur.com/d5v66Bx.png "Enlarge image")
> 

*Bah da DA DAHHHH da da nahhh!*

*Da naaaah na na naaaah!*

-Jn-

> 
> 7 minutes ago, JoeNapalm said:
> 
> 
> *Bah da DA DAHHHH da da nahhh!*
> 
> 
> 
> 
> *Da naaaah na na naaaah!*
> 

No idea whatsoever.

> 
> 
> 12 minutes ago, DChurchill said:
> 
> 
> No idea whatsoever.
> 

I think it's supposed to be from the James Bond theme.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ye8KvYKn9-0?start=40&feature=oembed" width="459"></iframe>

As for my favorite? It would have to be the ['Monocopter'](https://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/4hpsug/the_monocopter_paragon_of_comfortable_travel/) (Credit to [profossi](https://www.reddit.com/user/profossi) from the KSP Subreddit).

<iframe data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/?app=core&module=system&controller=embed&url=https%3A%2F%2Fgfycat.com%2FThriftyLittleEarwig" style="height:597px;"></iframe>

[@DChurchill](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/60282-dchurchill/)[@Silavite](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/156204-silavite/)

Indeed, Bond.

I had the exact same clip cued up, but decided my a cappella version was more entertaining...

...you know...for me. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

-Jn-

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-14T19:39:17Z" title="06/14/2016 07:39  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 14, 2016</time> by JoeNapalm**

I can laugh about it now, took 12 months though

![dojW1T8.png](http://i.imgur.com/dojW1T8.png)
Is that all debris...?  How, man, how?

thats super cool seeing how much stuff keeps left behind ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Corona688 said:
> 
> 
> Is that all debris...?  How, man, how?
> 

Yep that's all debris. I've still to this day no idea what happened. I docked the last piece of my interplanetary duna mission craft in orbit and all holy hell broke loose. Took me 2 weeks to build and another week to rebuild it.

> 
> 
> 24 minutes ago, dboi88 said:
> 
> 
> Yep that's all debris. I've still to this day no idea what happened. I docked the last piece of my interplanetary duna mission craft in orbit and all holy hell broke loose. Took me 2 weeks to build and another week to rebuild it.
> 

Was the last piece, by any chance, highly volatile?

-Jn-

Jebediah Kerman - so BadS that he can escape Kerbin's gravity by ~~jumping~~ falling off the Mun.

![1BAA69BD255B0EFC13B1E08E332B88C256F24AEF](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/846966879221900907/1BAA69BD255B0EFC13B1E08E332B88C256F24AEF/)

It could have had one of these on board.

![O0njidn.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/O0njidn.jpg)

> 
> 
> 16 hours ago, dboi88 said:
> 
> 
> It could have had one of these on board.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [![O0njidn.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/O0njidn.jpg)](http://i.imgur.com/O0njidn.jpg "Enlarge image")
> 

I'd like to read a technical paper written by a Kerbal. Where in real life we have warnings like this one:

![220px-Hypergolic_Fuel_for_MESSENGER.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Hypergolic_Fuel_for_MESSENGER.jpg/220px-Hypergolic_Fuel_for_MESSENGER.jpg)

Kerbals would write: "WARNING: Icky Boom Goop. NOT FOOD!"

> 
> 
> 28 minutes ago, cubinator said:
> 
> 
> I'd like to read a technical paper written by a Kerbal.
> 

I remember reading an MSDS for chlorine trifluoride...  It had an impressive series of images showing how it set fire to rubber safety gloves, frozen chicken, water, teflon tubing, sand, glass, metal, and a variety of safety equipment on contact.  Written by Kerbals, it'd probably be 37 pages of "AAAAAAA" with the occasional image like that.
